bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 173 (Thursday, October 31, 2019)][House][Pages H8720-H8721]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. WEXTON:H.R. 4971.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8, clause 7By Miss. item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Domestic Offshore Energy Reinvestment Act of 2019

This bill increases the revenue Gulf states (Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi, and Alabama) receive from certain federal oil and gas leases in the Gulf of Mexico and eliminates the revenue sharing cap.

bill.title: Domestic Offshore Energy Reinvestment Act of 2019

item.title: Domestic Offshore Energy Reinvestment Act of 2019
To amend the Gulf of Mexico Energy Security Act of 2006, and for other purposes.
Domestic Offshore Energy Reinvestment Act of 2019

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Energy and Mineral Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
